message: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

message: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

message: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
author: Albert Schweitzer

message: You miss 100% of the shots you don't take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

message: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

message: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

message: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

message: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

message: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
author: Peter Drucker

message: Change your thoughts and you change your world.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

message: Don't watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

message: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

message: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

message: Do what you can with all you have, wherever you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

message: Motivation is what gets you started. Habit is what keeps you going.
author: Jim Ryun

message: The only impossible journey is the one you never begin.
author: Tony Robbins

message: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

message: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

message: In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

message: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.
author: Chris Grosser

message: It is never too late to be what you might have been.
author: George Eliot

message: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
author: Mark Twain

message: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

message: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

message: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

message: You can’t use up creativity. The more you use, the more you have.
author: Maya Angelou

message: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

message: If you're going through hell, keep going.
author: Winston Churchill

message: Limit your 'always' and your 'nevers'.
author: Amy Poehler

message: Success is not the result of spontaneous combustion. You must set yourself on fire.
author: Arnold H. Glasow

message: It does not matter how slowly you go, as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

message: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

message: You can't fall if you don't climb. But there's no joy in living your whole life on the ground.
author: Unknown

message: Keep your face always toward the sunshine—and shadows will fall behind you.
author: Walt Whitman

message: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

message: Limitations live only in our minds. But if we use our imaginations, our possibilities become limitless.
author: Jamie Paolinetti

message: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
author: Les Brown

message: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

message: If you want to lift yourself up, lift up someone else.
author: Booker T. Washington

message: Keep going. Everything you need will come to you at the perfect time.
author: Unknown

message: Dream it. Wish it. Do it.
author: Unknown

message: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

message: Life is 10% what happens to us and 90% how we react to it.
author: Charles R. Swindoll

message: Keep your eyes on the stars, and your feet on the ground.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

message: Sometimes you will never know the value of a moment until it becomes a memory.
author: Dr. Seuss

message: We may encounter many defeats but we must not be defeated.
author: Maya Angelou

message: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

message: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

message: Today’s accomplishments were yesterday’s impossibilities.
author: Robert H. Schuller

message: Happiness is not something ready-made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

message: The only thing standing between you and your goal is the story you keep telling yourself as to why you can't achieve it.
author: Jordan Belfort

message: Don't count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

message: You are braver than you believe, stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A.A. Milne
